latestVersion.specialPermissions: Additional special permissions, where applicable, are described in the restrictions field.
latestVersion.restrictions: These data are released in accordance with the  provisions of the General Education Provisions Act (GEPA). GEPA  protects privacy by ensuring that respondents will never be  individually identified. Under Public Law 100-297, the National Center  for Education Statistics is responsible for protecting the privacy of  individual respondents and is releasing these data to be used for  statistical purposes only. Record matching or deductive disclosure by  any user is prohibited. To ensure that the confidentiality provisions  contained in PL 100-297 have been fully implemented, procedures for  disclosure avoidance were used in preparing the data in this  release. Every effort has been made to provide the maximum research  information consistent with reasonable confidentiality  protections. Therefore, certain variables have been deleted and others have been recoded into broader categories.
latestVersion.conditions: AVAILABLE. This study is freely available to ICPSR member institutions.
latestVersion.disclaimer: The original collector of the data, ICPSR, 		and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility 		for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences 		based upon such uses.

fields.value: Schools and Staffing Survey, 1993-1994  [United States]:  Teacher Follow-Up Survey, 1994-1995, Revised Version

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection is a one-year follow-up of a sample of  teachers who responded to the Teacher Questionnaire in the SCHOOLS AND  STAFFING SURVEY, 1993-1994 [UNITED STATES]: REVISED VERSION (ICPSR  2748). The Teacher Follow-Up Survey was designed to update data on  teacher career patterns and plans and to determine attrition rates. It  queried a subsample of teachers who were in the profession during the  school year 1993-1994 and has two components: teachers who left the  teaching profession between the school years 1993-1994 and 1994-1995  (leavers) and teachers who remained in the profession  (stayers). Information in this collection is given separately for  public school teachers (Part 1) and private school teachers (Part  2). Questions were asked on topics such as current activity,  occupation, career patterns, educational pursuits, future plans,  attitudes toward the teaching profession, and overall job satisfaction.

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File DOC2763.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.;Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB2763.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.;Version Date: 2000-05-01Version Text: 2000-05-01 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: The SAS and SPSS data definition statements have been updated by the addition of value label statements.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS and SPSS data definition statements;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) This revised version of the collection is derived  from the NCES's "Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS) and Teacher  Followup Survey (TFS) CD-ROM: Public-Use Data for 3 Cycles of SASS and  TFS." (2) The codebook and technical manual are provided as Portable  Document Format (PDF) files. The PDF file format was developed by  Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader  software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to  obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR Website on the Internet.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

value: Elementary and secondary school teachers who taught in  schools that had a first grade and/or higher in the United States during the 1993-1994 school year.
